title: Segfault after update to v2.49.0 ("nonce too low"...)
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: v2.49.0 

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash: 034ef6381859a80799814f0b3e10baac9a2cf7db

Erigon Command (with flags/config): erigon --nat=stun --port=... --http.addr=... --http.vhosts=... --http.corsdomain=... --http.trace --http.api=eth,erigon,engine,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool **--internalcl** **--batchSize=128M** **--db.pagesize=16K** --metrics --metrics.addr=... --maxpeers=40 --staticpeers=...

Concensus Layer: --internalcl

Chain/Network: mainnet

#### Expected behaviour

Does not segfault.

#### Actual behaviour

Segfaults.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Run above command on v2.49.0.

#### Backtrace

````
[INFO] [09-08|20:34:36.981] [5/7 Execution] Completed on             block=18094105

panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x19510ef]
goroutine 620105 [running]:

	github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/turbo/execution/eth1/eth1_chain_reader.go/chain_reader.go:288 +0x1f0

	github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cl/phase1/execution_client/execution_client_direct.go:46 +0x334
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cl/phase1/forkchoice.(*ForkChoiceStore).OnBlock(0xc09b0670a0, 0xc17ad45d50, 0x1, 0x1?)
	github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cl/phase1/forkchoice/on_block.go:55 +0x2eb

github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cl/phase1/stages.ConsensusClStages.func10({0x2d98980, 0xc1837af310}, {0x2daac50, 0xc16a4328a0}, 0xc103216690, {0x12, 0x378e2, 0x378e3, 0x6f1c6e, 0x6f1c6d})
	github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cl/phase1/stages/clstages.go:351 +0x87a
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cl/clstages.(*StageGraph[...]).StartWithStage.func1()
	github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cl/clstages/clstages.go:39 +0xe4
created by github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cl/clstages.(*StageGraph[...]).StartWithStage
	github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cl/clstages/clstages.go:33 +0x3e5

````
When reverting back to 2.48.1, this error does not seem to occur.
recover the node with make integration && ./build/bin/integration stage_headers --unwind=1000 --chain=mainnet --datadir=<whatever>
This bug is now fixed in devel
